The plant produces small, yellow flowers clustered in spherical inflorescences, which are typically visited by bees and other pollinators. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of numerous small, oval leaflets arranged in a feathery pattern. Acacia adsurgens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
